kpi_info.title: period_duration (period_duration)
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: NET_OUT_NNI (M545C1)
kpi_info.use: Network out of order (#38).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 38. This indicates that the network is not functioning correctly and that the condition is likely to last a relatively long period of time; e.g. immediately attempting the call again is not likely to be successful. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: TEMP_FAIL_NNI (M545C2)
kpi_info.use: Temporary failure (#41).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 41. The cause code indicates that the network is not functioning correctly and that the condition is not likely to last for a long period of time; e.g. the user may wish to try another call attempt almost immediately. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: CONGESTION_NNI (M545C3)
kpi_info.use: Switching equipment congestion (#42).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 42. The cause c ode indicates that the switching equipment generating this cause is experiencing a period of high traffic. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: REQ_CHAN_NNI (M545C4)
kpi_info.use: Requested circuit/channel not available (#44).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 44. This cause is returned when the circuit or channel indicated by the requesting entity cannot be provided by the other side of the interface. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: RES_UNAVAIL_NNI (M545C5)
kpi_info.use: Resource unavailable unspecified (#47).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 47. This cause is used to report a resource unavailable event only when no other cause in the resource unavailable class applies. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: AAL_PARA_NNI (M545C6)
kpi_info.use: AAL parameters can not be supported (#93).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 93. This cause is used to indicate that the requested AAL parameters cannot be provided. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: INVALID_MSG_NNI (M545C7)
kpi_info.use: Invalid message (#95).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 95. This cause is used to report an invalid message event only when no other cause in the invalid message class applies. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: MANDAT_INFO_NNI (M545C8)
kpi_info.use: Mandatory information element is missing (#96).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 96. This cause indicates that the equipment sending the cause has received a message which is missing an information element which must be present in the message before that message can be processed. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: MSG_NOT_IMPL_NNI (M545C9)
kpi_info.use: Message type non-existent or not implemented (#97).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 9 7. This indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a message type which it does not recognize either because this is a message not defined or defined but not implemented by the equipment sending this cause. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: INFO_NOT_IMPL_NNI (M545C10)
kpi_info.use: "Information element non-existent or not implemented (#99).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 99. This indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message which includes information elements/parameters not recognized because the information element identifiers/parameter names are not defined or are defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the cause. This cause indicates that the information elements/parameters were discarded. However, the information element is not required to be present in the message in order for the equipment sending the cause to process the message." Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: INVALID_INFO_NNI (M545C11)
kpi_info.use: "Invalid information element contents (#100). This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 100. T his cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received an information element which it has implemented however , one or more fields in the information element are coded in a way that has not been implemented by the equipment sending this cause." Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_ERQ_NNI (M545C12)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on ERQ_timer expiry (#102).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 102 establish re quest. Establish request Primitive is used by the AAL type 2 served user to start the establishment of a new AAL type 2 connection. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_REL_NNI (M545C13)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on REL_timer expiry (#102).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 102 release request. The Release request Primitive is used by the AAL type 2 served user to start the clearing of an AAL type 2 connection. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_RES_NNI (M545C14)
kpi_info.use: "Recovery on RES_timer expiry (#102).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 102 reset request. Reset request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to reset a particular channel, all channels on a particular AAL type 2 path, or all channels on all AAL type 2 paths between two nodes to the "Idle" state and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity." Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_BLO_NNI (M545C15)
kpi_info.use: "Recovery on BLO_timer expiry (#102).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 102 block request. Block request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to locally block a particular, unblocked AAL type 2 path and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity." Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_UBL_NNI (M545C16)
kpi_info.use: "Recovery on UBL_timer expiry (#102).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 102 unblock request. Unblock request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to locally unblock a particular, blocked AAL type 2 path and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity." Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: MSG_UNRECOG_NNI (M545C17)
kpi_info.use: "Message with unrecognized parameter, discarded (#110).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 110. This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has discarded a received message which includes a parameter that is not recognized." Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: SAI_ALLOC_NNI (M545C18)
kpi_info.use: OSAI allocation failure.This is the same as the hand process reservation failure. Internal (non-protocol) error Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: CID_VERIF_NNI (M545C19)
kpi_info.use: The CID verification/allocation failure.Requested AAL type 2 channel (CID) was not available in the destination AAL type 2 nod e. Internal (non-protocol) error. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: AAL2PI_VERIF_NNI (M545C20)
kpi_info.use: The AAL type 2 Id verification/allocation failure.Requested AAL type 2 Path Identifier was not available in the destination AA L type 2 node. Internal (non-protocol) error. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: BINDING_ID_VERIF_NNI (M545C21)
kpi_info.use: Binding id verification failure.Requested Binding Identifier was not available at the destination AAL type 2 node. Internal (n on-protocol) error. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: LINK_CHAR_VERIF_NNI (M545C22)
kpi_info.use: Required traffic characterizations unavailable.Requested traffic characterization was not available in the destination AAL type 2 node. Internal (non-protocol) error. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: ADJ_NODE_NOT_AVAIL_NNI (M545C23)
kpi_info.use: Adjacent node not available.Connection establishment rejected since the signalling relation into the adjacent AAL type 2 node was not available. Internal (non-protocol) error. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: COMMON_NNI (M545C24)
kpi_info.use: Successful connection established.The number of connection events started in the AAL2 signalling. The successful cases are stated in the program block operation. Which can still fail at a later stage. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: NODAL_FUNCTION_NNI (M545C25)
kpi_info.use: Successful Nodal function transit connection established.The number of Nodal function transit connection events started in the AAL2 signalling. The successful cases are stated in the program block operation. Which can still fail at a later stage. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: UNALLOC_NUMB_NNI (M545C26)
kpi_info.use: "Unallocated (unassigned) number (#1).This parameter provides a count of the connections terminated by Cause No. 1. It indicates that the called party cannot be reached because, although the called party number is in a valid format, it is not currently allocated (assigned)." Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: NO_ROUTE_NNI (M545C27)
kpi_info.use: No route to destination (#3).This parameter provides a count of the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 3. This indicates that the called party cannot be reached because the network through which the call has been routed does not serve the destination desired. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: NO_CHANNEL_NNI (M545C28)
kpi_info.use: No circuit or channel available (#34).This parameter provides the number of connections terminated to Cause No. 34. This indicates that there is no appropriate circuit or channel presently available to handle the call. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.

kpi_info.title: RES_MAN_OVERLOAD (M545C29)
kpi_info.use: Resource manager overload.Connection establishment rejected since the resource manager overload protection is activated (ticket not received from ticket service) in the destination AAL type 2 node. Note: This counter doesn't have a formula and the default (SUM) was used.
